result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontil C Sercy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CM322, 15CM436, 16CM12 & 16CM250 called together at 1:22 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Dontil C Sercy in court, in-custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-15CM322, Cts#1 & #2-15CM436, Cts#1 & #2-16CM12 & Cts#1, #2 & #3-16CM250; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts in each case
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses DA Case 15JE2685-CM Bailjumping (dov: 12/3/15) Agency Case 159462 in the City of Fort Atkinson, and bars it from further prosecution

On Counts #1, #2 & #3-16CM250, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for work and treatment; each count, concurrent, to commence forthwith 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--7 days credit for time served given
--costs due forthwith, failure to pay is entry of civil judgment


On Ct#1-15CM322, Cts#1 & #2-15CM436 & Cts#1 & #2-16CM12, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, consecutive to jail in 16CM250, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No contact with Nicole Wellman
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--Complete certified batterer's intervention assessment and follow through with all recommendations of assessor
--No acts/threats of violence 
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To pay statutory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the domestic abuse surcharges on the domestic abuse charges & DNA Surcharges
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $33 subpoena fees (15CM322)

Days credit for time already served: 46 days-15CM322
Days credit for time already served: 47 days-15CM436
Days credit for time already served: 46 days-16CM12
Recess: 1:48 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Cases 15CM322, 15CM436, 16CM12 & 16CM250 called together at 10:48 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Dontil C Sercy in court, in-custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hagemann informs the Court that plea/sentencing will be next week, received date from Court's JA prior to going on the record, requests to conduct initial appearance in new matter and adjourn to next week.

16CM250; Service of the complaint admitted; reading waived; charge/penalties recited
Pleas of Not Guilty entered; speedy trial waived
Court orders that bond in other cases extend to case 16CM250, upon no objection from parties
Recess: 10:51 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 6/10/16 at 1:15 pm - Send notices
Status conference on June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

[MK] cases #15CM322, #15CM436,and #16CM12 called at 3:12pm. 
Defendant Dontil C Sercy in court, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hagemann indicates that the Defense is still negotiating a settlement;  her understanding is that new charges are forthcoming. There is no resolution yet, however they are working toward a global settlement of the cases and Attorney Hagemann requests the scheduling of another status soon.
The Court continues Bond.
recess 3:16pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference (likely plea and sentencing) on 6/3/16 at 10:30am.
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II:  
[MK] cases #15CM322, #15CM436, #16CM12 called at 2:02pm. 
Defendant Dontil C Sercy appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will represent on all cases).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

In response to the Court's inquiry about mailing address, Attorney Svehlek indicates that Mr. Sercy currently does not have a residence.  
Initial Appearance held in Case #16CM12:
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
---Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense

The Court requires a $1,000 Cash Bond which applies to all three cases.  The Court clarifies that this amount is above and beyond the bond amount previously posted. 
The conditions of this Bond are:  
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact
 with Nicole Wellman
--no discussion of the facts of the case with DaVion Turner or Arriana Winters
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

The Court indicates that it is quashing the Warrants in these cases.  
recess 2:09pm. 


NEXT:   Status Conference (likely Plea/Sentencing) on all three cases on 5/10/16 at 2:30pm
Duplicate Original Warrnant received from JCSD - Defendant is in custody
Proposed Order for Judgment of Bail Bond Forfeiture

Case called at 1:47pm [mo]
Defendant Dontil C Sercy not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On the Request of the State, the Court forfeits bond.
The Court notes that the warrant remains in effect.
recess: 1:48pm

Court's Response to State's Motion - No need to schedule at this time as BW is pending - RRK
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing 3/10/16 at 1:15 pm

Attorney Whitney Hagemann in court. Defendant Dontil C Sercy not in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Hagemann informs the Court that she does not have explanation for Mr. Sercy's non apperarance
ADA Shock requests bench warrant in 15CM322 & probable cause warrant in 16CM12
Court finds the bond to be in default in 15CM322 and orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only

Court informs parties that Mr. Sercy has another pending matter - 15CM436, will set that matter for STC to see if Mr. Sercy appears, if he does not, will take the trial date off the calendar at that time

Cases 15CM322 & 15CM436 called together at 2:55 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Dontil C Sercy in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hagemann: We're negotiating offer; however issues have come up, request to hear bond modification

15CM322: On State's Motion to Modify Bond
Arguments presented; off-record: 3:01 - 3:03 pm for Defense Counsel/Client to confer

Court presents basis and grants motion to modify bond and requires a $500 CASH BOND with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Nicole Wellman
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
--no presence at the residence of Nicole Wellmann, or within 1000 feet of her residence
--not to discuss the facts of the case with DaVion Turner or Arriana Winters
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

As to both cases: Atty Hagemann requests both matters be set for trial, still waive time limits. Requests matters not be set for same dates
Recess: 3:10 pm 

NEXT: 
15CM322 (1) Schedule FSSC 1/19/16 at 3:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 1/25/16 at 8:30 am (Atty Hagemann only available on the 25th) - Send notices
15CM436 (1) Schedule FSSC 2/23/16 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 2/29/16 at 8:30 am

[MK]  case called at 1:20pm. 
Defendant Dontil C Sercy appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Sercy verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Nicole Wellman
--no presence at the residence of Nicole Wellmann
--not to discuss the facts of the case with DaVion Turner or Arriana Winters
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 1:24pm.
